column3: 3 Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle
2 Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug
10 Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone

11 check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.
5 Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
4 Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
7 spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone
8 Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
12 Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
13 Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.
14 pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
15 drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
16 Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds
